data.name: CmdEnvironmentVariableDescription
data.value:
Sets the value of an environment variable. Creates the variable if it does not exist, overrides if it does. This argument can be specified multiple times to provide multiple variables.
Examples: -e VARIABLE=abc -e VARIABLE="value with spaces" -e VARIABLE="value;seperated with;semicolons" -e VAR1=abc -e VAR2=def -e VAR3=ghi

data.name: CmdTestEnvironmentVariableDescription
data.value:
Sets the value of an environment variable. Creates the variable if it does not exist, overrides if it does. This will force the tests to be run in an isolated process. This argument can be specified multiple times to provide multiple variables.
Examples: -e VARIABLE=abc -e VARIABLE="value with spaces" -e VARIABLE="value;seperated with;semicolons" -e VAR1=abc -e VAR2=def -e VAR3=ghi

data.name: CmdEnvironmentVariableExpression
data.value: NAME="VALUE"

data.name: IncorrectlyFormattedEnvironmentVariables
data.value: Incorrectly formatted environment variables: {0}

data.value: Publish the .NET runtime with your application so the runtime doesn't need to be installed on the target machine. The default is 'false.' However, when targeting .NET 7 or lower, the default is 'true' if a runtime identifier is specified.

data.name: FrameworkDependentOptionDescription
data.value: Publish your application as a framework dependent application. A compatible .NET runtime must be installed on the target machine to run your application.

data.name: SelfContainAndNoSelfContainedConflict

data.name: CmdBlameCrashCollectAlwaysDescription
data.value: Enables collecting crash dump on expected as well as unexpected testhost exit.

data.name: CmdBlameCrashDescription
data.value:
Runs the tests in blame mode and collects a crash dump when the test host exits unexpectedly. This option depends on the version of .NET used, the type of error, and the operating system.
For exceptions in managed code, a dump will be automatically collected on .NET 5.0 and later versions. It will generate a dump for testhost or any child process that also ran on .NET 5.0 and crashed. Crashes in native code will not generate a dump. This option works on Windows, macOS, and Linux.
Crash dumps in native code, or when targetting .NET Framework, or .NET Core 3.1 and earlier versions, can only be collected on Windows, by using Procdump. A directory that contains procdump.exe and procdump64.exe must be in the PATH or PROCDUMP_PATH environment variable.
The tools can be downloaded here: https://docs.microsoft.com/sysinternals/downloads/procdump
To collect a crash dump from a native application running on .NET 5.0 or later, the usage of Procdump can be forced by setting the VSTEST_DUMP_FORCEPROCDUMP environment variable to 1.
Implies --blame.

data.name: CmdBlameCrashDumpTypeDescription
data.value: The type of crash dump to be collected. Supported values are full (default) and mini. Implies --blame-crash.

data.name: CmdBlameDescription
data.value:
Runs the tests in blame mode. This option is helpful in isolating problematic tests that cause the test host to crash or hang, but it does not create a memory dump by default.
When a crash is detected, it creates an sequence file in TestResults/guid/guid_Sequence.xml that captures the order of tests that were run before the crash.
Based on the additional settings, hang dump or crash dump can also be collected.
Example: Timeout the test run when test takes more than the default timeout of 1 hour, and collect crash dump when the test host exits unexpectedly. (Crash dumps require additional setup, see below.) dotnet test --blame-hang --blame-crash Example: Timeout the test run when a test takes more than 20 minutes and collect hang dump. dotnet test --blame-hang-timeout 20min

data.name: CmdBlameHangDescription
data.value: Run the tests in blame mode and enables collecting hang dump when test exceeds the given timeout.

data.name: CmdBlameHangDumpTypeDescription
data.value: The type of crash dump to be collected. The supported values are full (default), mini, and none. When 'none' is used then test host is terminated on timeout, but no dump is collected. Implies --blame-hang.

data.name: CmdBlameHangTimeoutDescription
data.value: Per-test timeout, after which hang dump is triggered and the testhost process is terminated. Default is 1h. The timeout value is specified in the following format: 1.5h / 90m / 5400s / 5400000ms. When no unit is used (e.g. 5400000), the value is assumed to be in milliseconds. When used together with data driven tests, the timeout behavior depends on the test adapter used. For xUnit, NUnit and MSTest 2.2.4+ the timeout is renewed after every test case, For MSTest before 2.2.4, the timeout is used for all testcases.

data.name: cmdCollectDescription
data.value: The friendly name of the data collector to use for the test run. More info here: https://aka.ms/vstest-collect

data.name: cmdCollectFriendlyName
data.value: DATA_COLLECTOR_NAME

data.name: PrintDownloadLinkOnlyDescription
data.value: Only print the list of links to download without downloading.

data.name: PrintSetVersionsDescription
data.value: 'dotnet workload search version' has three functions depending on its argument: 1. If no argument is specified, it outputs a list of the latest released workload versions from this feature band. Takes the --take option to specify how many to provide and --format to alter the format. Example: dotnet workload search version --take 2 --format json [{"workloadVersion":"9.0.201"},{"workloadVersion":"9.0.200.1"}] 2. If a workload version is provided as an argument, it outputs a table of various workloads and their versions for the specified workload version. Takes the --format option to alter the output format. Example: dotnet workload search version 9.0.201 Workload manifest ID Manifest feature band Manifest Version ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ microsoft.net.workload.emscripten.current 9.0.100-rc.1 9.0.0-rc.1.24430.3 microsoft.net.workload.emscripten.net6 9.0.100-rc.1 9.0.0-rc.1.24430.3 microsoft.net.workload.emscripten.net7 9.0.100-rc.1 9.0.0-rc.1.24430.3 microsoft.net.workload.emscripten.net8 9.0.100-rc.1 9.0.0-rc.1.24430.3 microsoft.net.sdk.android 9.0.100-rc.1 35.0.0-rc.1.80 microsoft.net.sdk.ios 9.0.100-rc.1 17.5.9270-net9-rc1 microsoft.net.sdk.maccatalyst 9.0.100-rc.1 17.5.9270-net9-rc1 microsoft.net.sdk.macos 9.0.100-rc.1 14.5.9270-net9-rc1 microsoft.net.sdk.maui 9.0.100-rc.1 9.0.0-rc.1.24453.9 microsoft.net.sdk.tvos 9.0.100-rc.1 17.5.9270-net9-rc1 microsoft.net.workload.mono.toolchain.current 9.0.100-rc.1 9.0.0-rc.1.24431.7 microsoft.net.workload.mono.toolchain.net6 9.0.100-rc.1 9.0.0-rc.1.24431.7 microsoft.net.workload.mono.toolchain.net7 9.0.100-rc.1 9.0.0-rc.1.24431.7 microsoft.net.workload.mono.toolchain.net8 9.0.100-rc.1 9.0.0-rc.1.24431.7 3. If one or more workloads are provided along with their versions (by joining them with the '@' character), it outputs workload versions that match the provided versions. Takes the --take option to specify how many to provide and --format to alter the format. Example: dotnet workload search version maui@9.0.0-rc.1.24453.9 ios@17.5.9270-net9-rc1 9.0.201

data.name: ProjectConvertAppFullName
data.value: Convert a file-based program to a project-based program.

data.name: ProjectConvertDryRun
data.value: Determines changes without actually modifying the file system

data.name: ProjectManifest
data.value: PROJECT_MANIFEST

data.name: ProjectManifestDescription
data.value: The XML file that contains the list of packages to be stored.

data.name: PublishAppDescription
data.value: Publisher for the .NET Platform

data.name: PublishConfigurationOptionDescription
data.value: The configuration to publish for. The default is 'Release' for NET 8.0 projects and above, but 'Debug' for older projects.

data.name: PublishFrameworkOptionDescription
data.value: The target framework to publish for. The target framework has to be specified in the project file.

data.name: PublishOutputOption
data.value: OUTPUT_DIR

data.name: PublishOutputOptionDescription
data.value: The output directory to place the published artifacts in.

data.name: PublishRuntimeOptionDescription
data.value: The target runtime to publish for. This is used when creating a self-contained deployment. The default is to publish a framework-dependent application.

data.name: RazorOptionDescription
data.value: Shut down the Razor build server.

data.name: ReferenceAddAppFullName
data.value: Add a project-to-project reference to the project.

data.name: ReferenceAddCmdFrameworkDescription
data.value: Add the reference only when targeting a specific framework.

data.name: ReferenceAddProjectPathArgumentDescription
data.value: The paths to the projects to add as references.

data.name: ReferenceAddProjectPathArgumentName
data.value: PROJECT_PATH

data.name: ReferenceListAppFullName
data.value: List all project-to-project references of the project.

data.name: ReferenceRemoveAppFullName
data.value: Remove a project-to-project reference from the project.

data.name: ReferenceRemoveCmdFrameworkDescription
data.value: Remove the reference only when targeting a specific framework.

data.name: ReferenceRemoveProjectPathArgumentDescription
data.value: The paths to the referenced projects to remove.

data.name: ReferenceRemoveProjectPathArgumentName
data.value: PROJECT_PATH

data.name: RemoveAppFullName
data.value: Remove one or more projects from a solution file.

data.name: RemoveProjectPathArgumentDescription
data.value: The project paths or names to remove from the solution.

data.name: RemoveProjectPathArgumentName
data.value: PROJECT_PATH

data.name: RestoreAppFullName
data.value: .NET dependency restorer

data.name: RollForwardOptionDescription
data.value: Allow a .NET tool to roll forward to newer versions of the .NET runtime if the runtime it targets isn't installed.

data.name: RunAppFullName
data.value: .NET Run Command

data.name: RunConfigurationOptionDescription
data.value: The configuration to run for. The default for most projects is 'Debug'.

data.name: RunFrameworkOptionDescription
data.value: The target framework to run for. The target framework must also be specified in the project file.

data.name: RunRuntimeOptionDescription
data.value: The target runtime to run for.

data.name: SdkAppFullName

data.name: SdkCheckAppFullName
data.value: .NET SDK Check Command

data.name: SkipManifestUpdateOptionDescription
data.value: Skip updating the workload manifests.

data.name: SkipOptimizationOptionDescription
data.value: Skip the optimization phase.

data.name: SkipSignCheckOptionDescription
data.value: Skip signature verification of workload packages and installers.

data.name: SkipSymbolsOptionDescription
data.value: Skip creating symbol files which can be used for profiling the optimized assemblies.

data.name: SolutionAppFullName
data.value: .NET modify solution file command

data.name: SolutionArgumentDescription
data.value: The solution file to operate on. If not specified, the command will search the current directory for one.

data.name: SolutionArgumentName
data.value: SLN_FILE

data.name: SourceArgumentName
data.value: Source

data.name: SourceDescription
data.value: The package source to search. You can pass multiple `--source` options to search multiple package sources. Example: `--source https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json`.

data.name: StoreAppDescription
data.value: Stores the specified assemblies for the .NET Platform. By default, these will be optimized for the target runtime and framework.

data.name: StoreFrameworkOptionDescription
data.value: The target framework to store packages for. The target framework has to be specified in the project file.

data.name: StoreOutputOption
data.value: OUTPUT_DIR

data.name: StoreOutputOptionDescription
data.value: The output directory to store the given assemblies in.

data.name: StoreRuntimeOptionDescription
data.value: The target runtime to store packages for.

data.name: TempDirOptionDescription
data.value: Specify a temporary directory for this command to download and extract NuGet packages (must be secure).

data.name: DotnetTestCommandVSTestDescription
data.value: .NET Test Command for VSTest. To use Microsoft.Testing.Platform, opt-in to the Microsoft.Testing.Platform-based command via global.json. For more information, see https://aka.ms/dotnet-test.

data.name: TestCmdNoLogo
data.value: Run test(s), without displaying Microsoft Testplatform banner

data.name: TestCmdOutputDir
data.value: OUTPUT_DIR

data.name: TestConfigurationOptionDescription
data.value: The configuration to use for running tests. The default for most projects is 'Debug'.

data.name: TestFrameworkOptionDescription
data.value: The target framework to run tests for. The target framework must also be specified in the project file.

data.name: TestRuntimeOptionDescription
data.value: The target runtime to test for.

data.name: ToolCommandDescription

data.name: WorkloadHistoryCommandDescription

data.name: SolutionAddReferencedProjectsOptionDescription
data.value: Recursively add projects' ReferencedProjects to solution

data.name: ToolExecuteCommandDescription
data.value: Executes a tool from source without permanently installing it.

data.name: PackCmdVersionDescription
data.value: The version of the package to create

data.name: PackCmdVersion
data.value: VERSION

data.name: CmdMinimumExpectedTestsDescription
data.value: Specifies the minimum number of tests that are expected to run.

data.name: Option_Output
data.value: Location to place the generated output.

data.name: Command_AliasAdd_Description
data.value: Creates an alias for instantiate command with a certain set of arguments.

data.name: Command_AliasShow_Description
data.value: Displays defined aliases.

data.name: Command_Alias_Description
data.value: Creates or displays defined aliases.

data.name: Command_Details_Description
data.value: Provides the details for specified template package. The command checks if the package is installed locally, if it was not found, it searches the configured NuGet feeds.

data.name: Command_Install_Argument_Package
data.value: NuGet package ID or path to folder or NuGet package to install. To install the NuGet package of certain version, use <package ID>::<version>.

data.name: Command_Install_Description
data.value: Installs a template package.

data.name: Command_Instantiate_Argument_ShortName
data.value: A short name of the template to create.

data.name: Command_Instantiate_Argument_TemplateOptions
data.value: Template specific options to use.

data.name: Command_Instantiate_Description
data.value: Instantiates a template with given short name. An alias of 'dotnet new <template name>'.

data.name: Command_Legacy_Update_Check_Description
data.value: Checks the currently installed template packages for updates.

data.name: Command_List_Argument_Name
data.value: If specified, only the templates matching the name will be shown.

data.name: Command_List_Description
data.value: Lists templates containing the specified template name. If no name is specified, lists all templates.

data.name: Command_New_Description
data.value: Template Instantiation Commands for .NET CLI.

data.name: Command_Search_Argument_Name
data.value: If specified, only the templates matching the name will be shown.

data.name: Command_Search_Description
data.value: Searches for the templates on NuGet.org.

data.name: Command_Uninstall_Argument_Package
data.value: NuGet package ID (without version) or path to folder to uninstall. If command is specified without the argument, it lists all the template packages installed.

data.name: Command_Uninstall_Description
data.value: Uninstalls a template package.

data.name: Command_Update_Description
data.value: Checks the currently installed template packages for update, and install the updates.

data.name: Command_Update_Option_CheckOnly
data.value: Only checks for updates and display the template packages to be updated without applying update.

data.name: ListCommand_Option_IgnoreConstraints
data.value: Disables checking if the template meets the constraints to be run.

data.name: Option_AddSource
data.value: Specifies a NuGet source to use.

data.name: Option_AuthorFilter
data.value: Filters the templates based on the template author.

data.name: Option_BaselineFilter
data.value: Filters the templates based on baseline defined in the template.

data.name: Option_Columns
data.value: Specifies the columns to display in the output.

data.name: Option_ColumnsAll
data.value: Displays all columns in the output.

data.name: Option_Debug_Attach
data.value: Allows to pause execution in order to attach to the process for debug purposes.

data.name: Option_Debug_CustomSettings
data.value: Sets custom settings location.

data.name: Option_Debug_RebuildCache
data.value: If specified, removes the template cache prior to command execution.

data.name: Option_Debug_Reinit
data.value: If specified, resets the settings prior to command execution.

data.name: Option_Debug_ShowConfig
data.value: If specified, shows the template engine config prior to command execution.

data.name: Option_Debug_VirtualSettings
data.value: If specified, the settings will be not preserved on file system.

data.name: Option_Install_Force
data.value: Allows installing template packages from the specified sources even if they would override a template package from another source.

data.name: Option_Interactive
data.value: Allows the command to stop and wait for user input or action (for example to complete authentication).

data.name: Option_LanguageFilter
data.value: Filters templates based on language.

data.name: Option_PackageFilter
data.value: Filters the templates based on NuGet package ID.

data.name: Option_ProjectPath
data.value: The project that should be used for context evaluation.

data.name: Option_TagFilter
data.value: Filters the templates based on the tag.

data.name: Option_TypeFilter
data.value: Filters templates based on available types. Predefined values are "project" and "item".
data.comment: project and item should not be translated

data.name: TemplateCommand_Option_DryRun
data.value: Displays a summary of what would happen if the given command line were run if it would result in a template creation.

data.name: TemplateCommand_Option_Force
data.value: Forces content to be generated even if it would change existing files.

data.name: TemplateCommand_Option_Name
data.value: The name for the output being created. If no name is specified, the name of the output directory is used.

data.name: TemplateCommand_Option_NoUpdateCheck
data.value: Disables checking for the template package updates when instantiating a template.

data.name: Commands_Validator_WrongTokens
data.value: Unrecognized command or argument(s): {0}.
data.comment: {0} - wrong token or comma-separated tokens (if multiple). Each token is enclosed with single quotes: 'token'.

data.name: DetailsCommand_Argument_PackageIdentifier
data.value: Package identifier

data.name: DisableSdkTemplates_OptionDescription
data.value: If present, prevents templates bundled in the SDK from being presented.

data.name: DisableProjectContextEval_OptionDescription
data.value: Disables evaluating project context using MSBuild.

data.name: Verbosity_OptionDescription
data.value: Sets the verbosity level. Allowed values are q[uiet], m[inimal], n[ormal], and diag[nostic].

data.name: Diagnostics_OptionDescription
data.value: Enables diagnostic output.

data.name: SDKSchemaCommandDefinition
data.value: Display the command schema as JSON.
